properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 3 at 12:46PM AKST until January 5 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will
cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
Expect wind chills to range from 35 below zero to 45 below
zero.

* WHERE...Over Dalton Highway Summits.

* WHEN...Now to 6 AM Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds gusting to 30 mph will
cause blowing and drifting snow over the Dalton Highway Summits
and wind chills to 45 below. Travelers should be prepared to
encounter snow drifts and dangerously cold wind chills.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY
